content: Vision of the Man with a Measuring Rod

In the twenty-fifth year of our exile, at the beginning of the year, on the tenth of the month, in the fourteenth year after the city was taken, on this very day the hand of the LORD was upon me and He brought me there.
In the visions of God He brought me into the land of Israel and set me on a very high mountain, and on it to the south  like a structure of a city.
So He brought me there; and behold, there was a man whose appearance was like the appearance of bronze, with a thread of flax and a measuring rod in his hand; and he was standing in the gateway.

And the man said to me, “Son of man, see with your eyes, hear with your ears, and pay attention to all that I am going to show you; for you have been brought here in order to show  to you. Declare to the house of Israel all that you see.”
Measurements Relating to the Temple

And behold, there was a wall on the outside of the temple all around, and in the man’s hand was a measuring rod of six cubits, each of which was a cubit and a hand width. So he measured the thickness of the wall, one rod; and the height, one rod.
Then he went to the gate which faced east, went up its steps, and measured the threshold of the gate, one rod in width; and the other threshold  one rod in width.
The guardroom  one rod long and one rod wide; and  five cubits between the guardrooms. And the threshold of the gate by the porch of the gate facing inward  one rod.
Then he measured the porch of the gate facing inward, one rod.
And he measured the porch of the gate, eight cubits; and its side pillars, two cubits. And the porch of the gate was faced inward.
The guardrooms of the gate toward the east  three on each side; the three of them had the same measurement. The side pillars also had the same measurement on each side.
And he measured the width of the gateway, ten cubits,  the length of the gate, thirteen cubits.
a barrier  one cubit  in front of the guardrooms on each side; and the guardrooms  six cubits  on each side.
And he measured the gate from the roof of the one guardroom to the roof of the other, a width of twenty-five cubits, from  door to  door opposite.
He made the side pillars sixty cubits ; the gate  all around to the side pillar of the courtyard.
And  the front of the entrance gate to the front of the inner porch of the gate  fifty cubits.

And  shuttered windows  toward the guardrooms, and toward their side pillars within the gate all around, and likewise for the porches. And  windows all around inside; and on  side pillar  palm tree decorations.
Then he brought me into the outer courtyard, and behold,  chambers and a stone pavement made for the courtyard all around; thirty chambers faced the pavement.
And the pavement (, the lower pavement)  by the side of the gates, corresponding to the length of the gates.
Then he measured the width from the front of the lower gate to the front of the exterior of the inner courtyard, a hundred cubits on the east and on the north.
And  the gate of the outer courtyard which faced north, he measured its length and its width.
It had three guardrooms on each side; and its side pillars and its porches had the same measurement as the first gate. Its length  fifty cubits, and the width twenty-five cubits.
Its windows, its porches, and its palm tree decorations  the same measurements as the gate which faced east; and it was reached by seven steps, and its porch  in front of them.
The inner courtyard had a gate opposite the gate on the north as well as  on the east; and he measured a hundred cubits from gate to gate.
Then he led me toward the south, and behold, there was a gate toward the south; and he measured its side pillars and its porches according to those same measurements.
The gate and its porches had windows all around like those other windows; the length  fifty cubits and the width, twenty-five cubits.
seven steps going up to it, and its porches  in front of them; and it had palm tree decorations on its side pillars, one on each side.
The inner courtyard had a gate toward the south; and he measured from gate to gate toward the south, a hundred cubits.
Then he brought me to the inner courtyard by the south gate; and he measured the south gate according to those same measurements.
Its guardrooms also, its side pillars, and its porches  according to those same measurements. And the gate and its porches had windows all around; it  fifty cubits long and twenty-five cubits wide.
porches all around, twenty-five cubits long and five cubits wide.
And its porches  toward the outer courtyard; and palm tree decorations  on its side pillars, and its stairway  eight steps.
Then he brought me into the inner courtyard toward the east. And he measured the gate according to those same measurements.
Its guardrooms also, its side pillars, and its porches  according to those same measurements. And the gate and its porches had windows all around; it  fifty cubits long and twenty-five cubits wide.
Its porches  toward the outer courtyard; and palm tree decorations  on its side pillars, on each side, and its stairway  eight steps.
Then he brought me to the north gate; and he measured  according to those same measurements,
its guardrooms, its side pillars, and its porches. And the gate had windows all around; the length  fifty cubits and the width twenty-five cubits.
And its side pillars  toward the outer courtyard; and palm tree decorations  on its side pillars, on each side, and its stairway had eight steps.
A chamber with its doorway was by the side pillars at the gates; there they rinse the burnt offering.
And in the porch of the gate  two tables on each side, on which to slaughter the burnt offering, the sin offering, and the guilt offering.
On the outer side, as one went up to the gateway toward the north,  two tables; and on the other side of the porch of the gate  two tables.
Four tables  on each side next to the gate; eight tables on which they slaughter .

For the burnt offering  four tables of cut stone, a cubit and a half long, a cubit and a half wide, and one cubit high, on which they set the utensils with which they slaughter the burnt offering and the sacrifice.
And the double hooks, one hand width , were installed in the house all around; and on the tables  the flesh of the offering.

From the outside to the inner gate were chambers for the singers in the inner courtyard,  which was at the side of the north gate, with its front toward the south,  one at the side of the south gate facing north.
Then he said to me, “This is the chamber which faces south,  for the priests who are responsible for the temple;
but the chamber which faces north is for the priests who are responsible for the altar. They are the sons of Zadok, who from the sons of Levi come near to the LORD to serve Him.”
He measured the courtyard, a  square, a hundred cubits long and a hundred cubits wide; and the altar was in front of the temple.
Then he brought me to the porch of the temple and measured  side pillar of the porch, five cubits on each side; and the width of the gate was three cubits on each side.
The length of the porch  twenty cubits, and the width eleven cubits; and at the stairway by which it was ascended  columns  to the side pillars, one on each side.
